BTC: Bitcoin (BTC) is a decentralized digital currency that enables peer-to-peer transactions on a secure blockchain network.
USD: US Dollar (USD) is the official currency of the United States and is widely used as a global reserve currency.
EUR: Euro (EUR) is the official currency of the Eurozone, used by 19 of the 27 European Union countries.
USDY: US Dollar Yield (USDY) is a yield-bearing digital asset representing US Dollar deposits earning interest.
SOL: Solana (SOL) is a high-performance blockchain supporting fast and low-cost transactions for decentralized applications.
XRP: Ripple (XRP) is a digital payment protocol and cryptocurrency designed for fast, low-cost international money transfers.
DOGE: Dogecoin (DOGE) is a meme-inspired cryptocurrency known for its active community and low transaction fees, often used for tipping and microtransactions.
SUI: Sui (SUI) is a layer-1 blockchain designed for high scalability and low latency, enabling fast execution of smart contracts and digital asset ownership.
AAPL: Apple Inc. (AAPL) is a leading technology company known for its consumer electronics, software, and digital services, including the iPhone and Mac.
NVDA: NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) is a global leader in graphics processing units (GPUs) and AI computing technologies used in gaming, data centers, and autonomous vehicles.
TSLA: Tesla Inc. (TSLA) is an electric vehicle and clean energy company that designs and manufactures EVs, battery storage systems, and solar products.
SPY: SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust (SPY) is an exchange-traded fund that tracks the performance of the S&P 500 Index, representing large-cap U.S. equities.
COIN: Coinbase Global Inc. (COIN) is a leading cryptocurrency exchange platform that enables users to buy, sell, and store a variety of digital assets.
